title: 2024)) of the Affordable Housing Act 2021 (No. 25 of 2021), hereby make the
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Affordable Housing Act 2021
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Affordable Housing Act 2021 

(Cost Rental Allocation Plan) Regulations 2025. 

Submission of allocation plan

title: 2024)) of the Affordable Housing Act 2021 (No. 25 of 2021), hereby make the
heading: 2. An allocation plan—
text_raw:
2. An allocation plan— 

(a) 

 shall identify the selected dwelling by reference to its address and 
Eircode; 

(b) 

shall be submitted to the Minister by electronic means; 

(c) 

shall be accompanied by a cover sheet with the details set out in 
the Schedule; 

(d) may be accompanied by such supporting materials as the landlord 
of the dwelling considers appropriate to assist the Minister in his 
or her decision; 

(e) 

shall include an electronic mail address to which notice of 
to approve by the Minister shall be given. 
approval or refusal

title: 2024)) of the Affordable Housing Act 2021 (No. 25 of 2021), hereby make the
heading: 3. Where a landlord applies to the Minister for approval of more than one
text_raw:
3. Where a landlord applies to the Minister for approval of more than one 
allocation plan, the Minister may, if approving all or any of the plans, make one 
approval in respect of the applications applied for. 

Further revision of application
text_norm: 3 landlord applies minister approval one allocation plan minister may approving plan make one approval respect application applied for revision application

title: 2024)) of the Affordable Housing Act 2021 (No. 25 of 2021), hereby make the
heading: 4. Where the Minister proposes certain changes to an allocation plan
text_raw:
4. Where the Minister proposes certain changes to an allocation plan 
submitted for his or her approval, the landlord of the selected dwelling may 
accept any or all of these changes by making a new submission to the Minister. 

Notice of approval or refusal to approve allocation plan
text_norm: 4 minister proposes certain change allocation plan submitted approval landlord selected dwelling may accept change making new submission minister notice approval refusal approve allocation plan

text_raw:
5. (1) Notice of the approval or refusal to approve an allocation plan by the 
Minister shall be given by electronic means to the electronic mail address

included in the application and this shall be deemed to be receipt by the landlord

of the approved allocation plan and specify the date on which the allocation plan 
shall come into operation.

heading: 6. An approved allocation plan shall be—
text_raw:
6. An approved allocation plan shall be— 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

published online by the landlord of the selected dwelling on a 
website maintained by the landlord and also in such other manner 
(if any) as the landlord may consider appropriate, 

included in advertisement materials for a tenancy in the selected

published by the Minister on a website maintained by the Minister

consider appropriate.

title: 2024)) of the Affordable Housing Act 2021 (No. 25 of 2021), hereby make the
heading: 7. (1) The application of the landlord of a selected dwelling for the
text_raw:
7. (1) The application of the landlord of a selected dwelling for the 
amendment of an approved allocation plan shall be made to the Minister by 
electronic means and include the proposed text of the allocation plan as 
amended. 

(2) Notice of the approval or refusal to approve the proposed amendment by 
the Minister shall be given by electronic means in the same manner as set out in 
Regulation 5. 

(3) Notice of the approval of the proposed amendment shall specify the date 

on which the amended allocation plan shall come into effect. 

Termination of approved allocation plan
text_norm: 7 (1) application landlord selected dwelling amendment approved allocation plan shall made minister electronic mean include proposed text allocation plan amended (2) notice approval refusal approve proposed amendment minister shall given electronic mean manner set regulation 5 (3) notice approval proposed amendment shall specify date amended allocation plan shall come effect termination approved allocation plan

title: 2024)) of the Affordable Housing Act 2021 (No. 25 of 2021), hereby make the
heading: 8. (1) The landlord of a selected dwelling may apply in writing, including
text_raw:
8. (1) The landlord of a selected dwelling may apply in writing, including 
by electronic means, to the Minister for the termination of an approved allocation 
plan and the Minister shall, within a period of 28 days from receipt of the 
application, confirm the termination of the plan and notify the landlord 
accordingly by electronic means. 

(2) An allocation plan shall cease to operate in respect of the selected 
dwelling from the date on which notice of the termination of the plan is given to 
the landlord of the dwelling by electronic means. 

Procedure for withdrawal of approval
text_norm: 8 (1) landlord selected dwelling may apply writing including electronic mean minister termination approved allocation plan minister shall within period 28 day receipt application confirm termination plan notify landlord accordingly electronic mean (2) allocation plan shall cease operate respect selected dwelling date notice termination plan given landlord dwelling electronic mean procedure withdrawal approval

title: 2024)) of the Affordable Housing Act 2021 (No. 25 of 2021), hereby make the
heading: 9. (1) Where approval of an allocation plan is withdrawn by the Minister
text_raw:
9. (1) Where approval of an allocation plan is withdrawn by the Minister 
under subsection (11) of section 31A of the Affordable Housing Act 2021 (No. 

 
 
 
 
 4 [306] 

25 of 2021), the landlord who has been given notice of withdrawal of approval 
may, within 14 days of being given notice, make representations to the Minister, 
who shall consider the representations and give notice in writing to the landlord, 
including by electronic means, of his or her decision. 

(2) A notice of withdrawal of an allocation plan takes effect 14 days after 
being given to the landlord concerned or, in the event of representations being 
made under paragraph (1), upon notice of the Minister’s decision to withdraw 
approval of the plan being given to the landlord.

title: 2024)) of the Affordable Housing Act 2021 (No. 25 of 2021), hereby make the
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations prescribe processes for the putting in place of an Allocation 
Plan for specified Cost Rental homes under Section 31A of the Affordable 
Housing Act 2021, as proposed by a Cost Rental landlord and approved at the 
discretion of the Minister for Housing, Local Government and Heritage. These 
Allocation Plans allow for limited variations from the standard letting process 
for Cost Rental homes, including the employment of certain selection criteria on 
which applicants may be prioritised.
